1) Location: 107 Anderson Road, Cheektowaga

Price: $1,939,229

Buyer: Goldman Sachs Group and Archon Group LP of Irving, Texas, through W2005/Fargo Hotels (Pool A) Realty LP

Seller: TMI Hospitality of Fargo, N.D., through Heritage Asset Management Inc.

Planned Use: Investment. Property is the three-story Residence Inn Buffalo Cheektowaga, a Marriott International hotel with 113 suites, located just off Walden Avenue to the west of the New York State Thruway exit. Archon, a wholly owned subsidiary of New York investment bank Goldman Sachs since 2000, is a real estate investment services and asset management firm that buys, develops, manages, finances and sells real estate in the retail, multifamily, office, industrial and hospitality sectors – including hotels.

2) Location: 110-112 Pearl St., Buffalo

Price: $1.325 million

Buyer: Paul Kolkmeyer and Greg Suffoletto of Priam Enterprises and unidentified investor, through 110 Pearl LLC

Seller: Michael Joseph/Clover Management of Clarence, through Dun Building LLC

Planned Use: Investment and continued operation of 10-story, 27,265-square-foot Dun Building, which is almost fully occupied by mix of office tenants, mostly law firms. Designed by E.B. Green and William Wicks, completed in 1895 and named for R.G. Dun & Co., this was the first high-rise, first steel-framed and first fireproof building in Buffalo. Joseph sold the building as part of his strategy to refocus on senior housing and apartments.

Buyer: Nick Sinatra/Sinatra & Co. Realty of Tonawanda, through Allentown Group Holdings LLC

Seats more than 50 in the restaurant and 14 in the bar, plus 60 in the covered patio and 150 in the open patio. Includes parking for about 30 cars. Sinatra is a real estate manager and developer who has become very active in Tonawanda, North Buffalo and other parts of the city in the past two years.

RealtyUSA purchases Utica-area brokerage

RealtyUSA has expanded again, buying a small real estate brokerage in the Utica-Rome area to enhance its Central New York presence.

The Williamsville-based firm, the largest independent real estate agency in the state, said it acquired Assist 2 Sell Seller’s & Buyer’s 1st Choice Realty in New Hartford, gaining an office and its staff.

The agency was founded by the late Joseph Hamlin, a third-generation Realtor and former owner of Hamlin & Scott Real Estate, whose wife, Mary Hamlin-Sunderman, became broker/owner in 2007. She will remain licensed and will continue in her role, along with the agency’s associate broker and office manager, Lisa Kowalczyk.

RealtyUSA, ranked No. 6 among the largest independent brokers nationwide by Real Trends, has 54 offices and more than 1,900 agents, serving the Buffalo, Rochester, Syracuse, Binghamton, Albany and Montrose, Pa., markets.
